caption:
This photograph features a dramatic and moody landscape under a dusk or dawn sky. The primary focus of the image is the sun, which appears as a muted, large, round glow through a hazy atmosphere, likely indicating either early morning or late evening light. The sun is framed by several sparse, leafless branches and a few with small leaves, possibly denoting a change in seasons or a harsh climate.

The branches are thin and delicate, creating an intricate silhouette against the illuminated backdrop of the sky. These silhouetted plants contrast with the soft, diffused light of the sun. The foreground is dark and undefined, which helps to direct the viewer's focus toward the central, brighter part of the image where the sun and branches are more prominently featured.

The color palette is primarily made up of blues and violets, adding to the cool and serene mood of the picture. There is no direct evidence of human presence in the scene, leading to a sense of solitude and natural tranquility. The overall composition is simple yet evocative, capturing a quiet moment in a natural setting.
title: Huckleberry bushes survive a clear-cut in the Olympic National Timberland near Olympic National Park, Washington. From the Environmental Protection Agency's Project DOCUMERICA collection, "In Praise of National Forests". For additional images see Fiche #s 209, 210, 211, 212, and 213. ENTHEOS. April, 1973.
